topic.title: How to Mute users
topic.body: You can mute users, just go to http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit put the cursor over the user name, click on the small icon that apears (three vertical dots) and select "mute user"

topic.title: How to run Telegram with Proxy
Everything THEY didn't teach you in school
topic.body:
US spending on science, space, and technology correlates with Suicides by hanging, strangulation and suffocation.

Number of people who drowned by falling into a pool correlates with Films Nicolas Cage appeared in.

Per capita cheese consumption correlates with Number of people who died by becoming tangled in their bedsheets.

Divorce rate in Maine correlates with Per capita consumption of margarine.

Age of Miss America correlates with Murders by steam, hot vapours and hot objects.

Total revenue generated by arcades correlates with Computer science doctorates awarded in the US.

Worldwide non-commercial space launches  correlates with Sociology doctorates awarded (US).

Per capita consumption of mozzarella cheese correlates with Civil engineering doctorates awarded.

People who drowned after falling out of a fishing boat correlates with Marriage rate in Kentucky.

US crude oil imports from Norway correlates with Drivers killed in collision with railway train.

Per capita consumption of chicken correlates with Total US crude oil imports.

Number people who drowned while in a swimming-pool correlates with Power generated by US nuclear power plants.

Japanese passenger cars sold in the US correlates with Suicides by crashing of motor vehicle.

Letters in Winning Word of Scripps National Spelling Bee correlates with Number of people killed by venomous spiders.

Math doctorates awarded correlates with Uranium stored at US nuclear power plants.

**Tell everyone this revealed truths! Flood every Dark Net forum with them!**

Source: http://tylervigen.com/spurious-correlations

1523147173_14RJhs7d84srMhP3Su4ErpZ5NfpXP.body:
https://indiehackers.com/ is a nice site where people share their ideas about how to build a small "bootstraped" business and enjoy life.
You may like it.

Basically the idea is to create a product or service that you build once, and then you can sell infinite times.

1523590539_1F7xewEeXa8Qn3JwoGGV7nkRYurjo.body:
Welcome!

You can find sites on http://127.0.0.1:43110/Sites.ZeroNetwork.bit/ or http://127.0.0.1:43110/0list.bit/ and other similar Directories.

When you enter a Zite it is automatically saved on the list on ZeroHello, you can also Fav sites moving the cursor over the name, clicking the tree vertical dots that appear and selecting "Add to Favorites"
You can also delete Zites that you dislike! using the "tree vertical dots" menu

1524280296_16CWdkXYYRnpct8GYS7GgD6yFcJHP.body: I use Telegram + Diaspora, I've also Matrix and XMPP clients installed but I don't really use them
The alternative to Twitter currently on trend in Mastodont

> [pool](#comment_4_123rY6a7W3RMmgFHrTdMR1NwGfciuKwsV4): Matrix chat protocol is server less

Matrix is decentralized, it still needs servers, like Diaspora or XMPP

> [chandelier](#comment_12_16CWdkXYYRnpct8GYS7GgD6yFcJHPXfMy8): I've realized this specific kind of decentralized social network, it's interesting and efficient currently as far as I'm concerned.

Yes, is the middle ground between  Centralized services like Facebook and Distributed services like ZeroNet
Funny enough Email is a Decentralized service by design. Monopolized by Google and others...

1524300556_1F9qtxgSgbkeJX7NT2BARwR8XCn1X.body:
I use DDG all the time, in general the results are more useful and I love the direct results and redirects to go straight to the answer.
For example:
- `! wiki Linux` to directly go to the Wikipedia page for Linux
- `urlencode Hello World` to encode text
- `18:00 EST` for automatic time convertion

For many questions it shows directly the answer, you don't need to enter any site. Google can't do that because it is focused to drive traffic to pages, no to give answers to questions.

> [shitchell](#comment_3_1LybGoL99LBuYE8ZtwgJC8dxkii3UmYKpo): Really? Have you used google in the last 5 years? If I type in "height of oprah" I get this: https://i.imgur.com/szvWArp.png [...]

Now try `how to sort a list in python` on both search engines. Anyway, is just a matter of what works better for each
Things I don't like about DDG: is not good (but is better than a few years ago) to search news, and to match the language of your preference with the results

1524481130_13kAufBz1uj9WtzbqWKkUkM8E1Y2S.body:
Is a great idea, but I am not entirely sure if it will work on ZeroNet.
ZeroNet don't work over blockchain so is not good  keeping track of things. For example if I review a driver I can change my review at any time.
Also it is not mobile friendly right now.

But will be great if somehow ZeroNet is adapted to create mobile friendly apps!

1524589266_1KDRKDBSjdQmoGoQo3fdCHia7mp2G.body:
I don't smoke, but I can share experiences from two friends:
- Friend A) He told me: At some time he started smoking all the time and loose some contact with reality, he loose his girlfriend and job. From that time on he started smoking less frequently "to not be too much relaxed about everything".
- Friend B) He smoke all the time and was a nice guy, you wanted to be like he, very relaxed and chill. But once I witnesses the gradual and horrible change on personality when for a few days he couldn't find weed. It was another person, grumpy almost violent. He was really in pain in that period of time.

I don't know if they were addict, but that is what I hear or saw from them.

1524935803_1LybGoL99LBuYE8ZtwgJC8dxkii3U.body:
ZeroNet is not decentralized, it is **distributed**. That means that every user should (ideally) share their computer power and bandwidth to maintain the network. Is the price to pay, but is optional.

If you are the only intended user of your site then there is no need to upload it your ZeroNet.
If the site is meant to be shared with others then there is plenty of places to put its address and people will kindly seed it (if they like it). I'm sure you only need a handful of people to keep the site "live".

Is the same idea behind Torrents.

1525258130_18NrbxMytZcJcDcsUadLeSAfZ2f49.body:
I love it. Makes a lot of sense.

I think the change is gradual, current people don't need to be "cleaned" (bad idea for those who tried), people will just gradually change.

> [natsoc](#comment_1_12rREqqdMUPsAPuMR1p87Zj8TS4YocoUCX): V[...] This project simply wants to create a modern or high tech prison, for people or workers or employees or labours, which will be controlled by emotion less Artificial intelligence computer (which big capitalists like facebook, google etc are already developing). And once we  entered this prison we will be left with no rights and will be on the mercy of emotionless AI.

Why is it a prison? Real Artificial Intelligence (in opposition to fictional AI) is just a tool that humans use, is just as emotion less as any other tool.

> [natsoc](#comment_1_12rREqqdMUPsAPuMR1p87Zj8TS4YocoUCX): V[...] We don't need technology for the efficient utilization of resources we just need enlightenment and bring the greedy capitalist manifesto to halt. We need to place human values and human societal development on top priority and limit capitalists within the shell of society.

Technology is everything we do, so we can't be without technology, is just impossible.

> [natsoc](#comment_1_12rREqqdMUPsAPuMR1p87Zj8TS4YocoUCX): V[...] We need to place human values and human societal development on top priority and limit capitalists within the shell of society.

Totally agree, I think the Venus project is just a description of a possible way to achieve that. What is the alternative you propose?

> [theanswerer0](#comment_25_1F2ZbgkHvpknveTB6wFa5xNEQBb8yxQnCR): Not the kind of AI we're talking about. [...]

I understand your concern. The problem is how we distribute the resources. Giving that power to an algorithm sounds scary.

But I think our current situation is worse. There is a system making those decisions, but is a Dumb system! It is just mostly random and power concentration driven.
Maybe a system that can take people needs into account will be an improvement.

Besides this system would not be centralized (Venus project make clear that the picture of the main computer controlling everything is just a bad metaphor).

I depict a distributed system, more efficient. Where small groups of people or even individuals can manage the basic needs of energy and food thanks to technology, without relying on any kind of grid.

On real world implementations I love this one: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Cybersyn

> [theanswerer0](#comment_26_1F2ZbgkHvpknveTB6wFa5xNEQBb8yxQnCR): I think we did a pretty good job before everything became so centralized.

The quality of life is improving steadily, so going back is not an option, I think will be better to look to the future
https://ourworldindata.org/famines#rate-of-people-dying-due-to-famines-since-1860
https://ourworldindata.org/water-access-resources-sanitation#number-of-people-without-access-to-an-improved-water-source
https://ourworldindata.org/war-and-peace#the-past-was-not-peaceful

This one is funny: "Happiness over time" and even have my own country, I would never ever imagined that the happines is increasing here XD XD
https://ourworldindata.org/happiness-and-life-satisfaction#changes-in-happiness-over-time-findings-from-the-world-value-survey

1526239496_1NEAivkF2GyHcnRQfJjahZD5XyWfJ.body:
You can subdivide it in smaller pieces, with some sort of index. And make each piece optional.
Then you load only the pieces needed for the user, each user will get / download a different set of pieces according to its usage.

The problem will be that the site will not be entirely seeded by all users.

For example could be possible make a zite with the entire Wikipedia, just storing each page as optional.

Would be extremely unusual that you need all 1Gb+ information at the same time, and no indexing is possible

1527813349_1PyrAjbZiHyfW7jSWeUpDPSeMU7sA.body:
The first time is normal to get the error, because the zite don't have any peers.
But the open port is needed when peers try to download or update the file. Is the port open? In ZeroHome you can check

1528119702_14vpMXmnJuhoQ8qv9oDVRh313TaUM.body:
The code for video is:

```
<video controls="" style="max-width: 100%" autoplay="" loop=""><source data-cke-saved-src="https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmWjEKZk3EiAUi3nPJds35dj4hrd8AWXTvpYYqdmxSKDbh" src="https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmWjEKZk3EiAUi3nPJds35dj4hrd8AWXTvpYYqdmxSKDbh" type="video/mp4">
Your browser does not support the video element.</video>
```

Remove `autoplay=""` and `loop=""` if you don't need it

1530712796_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: For me ZeroNet is mainly about a **Distributed Internet**, as an alternative to a clearnet dominated by Amazon, Google, Apple and Facebook. Everything else, like anonymity and freedom of speech is just a side effect.

> [realjohndoe](#comment_7_15tQJFZZ7KVYMX6XPUkcs138LcgDQ2zVcL): I don't think #zeronet is about the dark web or dark net. I think #zeronet is an attempt to reclaim the Open! #internet. I think #zeronet is off to a good start, and doing a Great! job. [...]
